message.content: {"reasoning":"During the attempted helicopter extraction, the downed NPC remains suspended under the chopper without any visible rope or harness and never rises toward the aircraft. The character’s ragdoll hangs in place in mid-air—even after the pilot flies off—then abruptly teleports and begins an erratic fall. This indicates the rope/hook physics or the NPC extraction animation has failed to attach and update correctly.","bug_report_title":"NPC Stuck Under Helicopter Without Extraction Rope","bug_report_description":"When calling in a helicopter extraction, the downed NPC spawns immediately beneath the aircraft but no rope or tether is visible. The character’s ragdoll is locked in place, hovering in mid-air and failing to be hoisted upward. After several seconds, the NPC teleports downward and the ragdoll begins a broken fall animation. This breaks immersion, prevents proper extraction, and may interfere with mission progression if the extraction can’t complete.","affected_item":"NI C/Physics (extraction rope and NPC animation)"}

{"reasoning":"Throughout the clip the helicopter’s main rotor blades do not appear as rigid, evenly spinning elements but instead bend and contort unnaturally between frames. This indicates a rendering or vertex‐interpolation error—likely tied to the motion blur/post‐processing pass—resulting in visible geometry warping rather than a smooth, consistent rotor sweep.","bug_report_title":"Helicopter rotor blades warp and bend during flight","bug_report_description":"While piloting the helicopter at night, the rotor blades intermittently deform into twisted, inconsistent shapes instead of maintaining a uniform circular sweep. The geometry appears stretched and contorted between frames, suggesting a glitch in the motion blur or vertex interpolation system. This visual artifact can be distracting during flight sequences and may impair player ability to judge rotor position or aircraft orientation.","affected_item":"Model rendering (rotor blades)"}

{"reasoning":"After dismounting the helicopter turret the player heads downhill on foot, and in the distance a parked ground vehicle suddenly appears suspended high above the landscape, completely defying gravity. The car remains floating in mid-air without any support or movement.","bug_report_title":"Ground vehicle stuck hovering in mid-air","bug_report_description":"When exiting the helicopter and moving toward the objective, a surface vehicle that should be parked at ground level is instead instantiated dozens of meters above the terrain and remains suspended there. The floating car neither falls nor respawns correctly and obstructs the intended world geometry. This breaks immersion and may block line of sight or navigation if approached.","affected_item":"Vehicle physics"}

{"reasoning":"During a nighttime boat segment on the Family Matters quest, the water surface fails to render dynamic waves, reflections, foam, or proper lighting. Instead of animated water physics and gloss, a static, low-resolution texture is displayed, and the boat even partially clips or sinks oddly into it. This clearly indicates a missing or corrupted water shader/texture or LOD issue.","bug_report_title":"Static, low-res water texture with missing waves and reflections","bug_report_description":"While navigating the boat at night, the lake’s surface renders as a flat, static, low-resolution pattern without any dynamic wave motion, foam, or environmental reflections. The water appears muddy and unlit, lacking normal specular highlights and shoreline reflections. At times the boat partially sinks into or clips through the water plane because the physic/animation is not applied. This severely breaks immersion and may affect boat handling and visibility of underwater hazards.","affected_item":"environment"}

{"reasoning":"While attempting to leap across two adjacent pirate ships, the character clips through the railing and the deck’s collision fails to register. The ship’s geometry even vanishes or shows garbled ‘camouflage’ meshes, causing the player to fall through the hull, sink out of bounds and trigger a forced ‘Desynchronizacja’ (fail) state.","bug_report_title":"Player Clips Through Ship Deck Gap and Falls Out of World","bug_report_description":"When the character jumps from one pirate ship to another, the collision on the railing and deck sometimes doesn’t register. The mesh either disappears or displays corrupted placeholder textures, letting the player drop between hulls into the water below. This out-of-bounds fall immediately desynchronizes the session, forcing a restart and losing any progress made since the last checkpoint. The issue appears reproducible on closely moored vessels or deck segments with tight gaps.","affected_item":"environment"}

{"reasoning":"While playing, the overhead enemy nameplate unexpectedly flips from identifying the target as an \"Eclipse Trooper\" to reading \"LOKI Mech Armor,\" even though no mech is present in the scene. This UI element is clearly out of context, pointing at a regular trooper and not a mech.","bug_report_title":"Enemy Nameplate Mislabels Trooper as \"LOKI Mech\"","bug_report_description":"During combat the enemy target UI (the red overhead bar) should show the troop’s name and correct armor/shield status. In this clip, after coming out of cover and targeting an Eclipse Trooper, the label briefly changes to “LOKI Mech Armor.” No mech is on‐screen and no previous mech encounter has occurred in this fight. This mislabel could mislead the player about enemy type, armor values, or which counter‐tactics to use.","affected_item":"UI"}

{"reasoning":"Throughout live play the heads-up display (HUD) for shots on target and the match score repeatedly spawns, flickers and overlaps the camera feed mid-game instead of appearing only during replays or stat updates. The overlay does not clear cleanly, blocks parts of the field view, and can persist for several seconds, indicating a UI rendering or state-transition glitch.","bug_report_title":"Persistent and Flickering Shots-On-Target/Scoreboard HUD Overlays During Play","bug_report_description":"During normal match action (at roughly 28–32 minutes) the “SKOTT PÅ MÅL” (shots on target) banner and score overlay suddenly appear on the screen, remain visible while play continues, then disappear and reappear multiple times. These HUD elements overlap the pitch, obscure player movement, and are not tied to a clear replay or pause event. The overlays also sometimes fail to unload, leaving semi-transparent remnants that block the view. This inconsistent spawning and removal of UI components disrupts gameplay immersion and can confuse players about current match status.","affected_item":"UI"}

{"reasoning":"In the sequence of screenshots, the player executes a silent takedown on an overseer— the kill objective counter updates from 14/20 to 15/20— yet the overseer’s model does not play a death animation or disappear. Instead, he stands back up, regains AI control, and begins attacking nearby slaves. This inconsistent state (marked as “killed” in the UI but still active in the world) clearly indicates a bug in the assassination/death-handling logic.","bug_report_title":"Overseer ‘resurrects’ after stealth takedown","bug_report_description":"When performing a stealth assassination on an overseer in tall grass, the kill counter correctly increments but the target’s character model never actually dies. The NPC fails to play any death animation or enter a ragdoll state, instead snapping back to an active stance and attacking nearby slaves. This ghost-like behavior undermines stealth mechanics, confuses the player, and can inadvertently affect side-objectives (slaves alive count).","affected_item":"Character AI / assassination/death handling"}

{"reasoning":"In this sequence the player summons their Spider-Drone to enter a broken window opening on a rooftop side mission, but instead of passing cleanly through the gap, the drone repeatedly collides with and clips into the window frame. It ping-pongs against the sill and remains stuck outside, unable to navigate past the geometry.","bug_report_title":"Spider-Drone Collides and Gets Stuck on Window Frame","bug_report_description":"When deploying the Spider-Drone near the rooftop window opening during the Prisoner Camp side mission, the drone’s collision boundaries catch on the window’s frame. Instead of flying through the opening, it clips into the sill and hovers outside, oscillating against the wall. This prevents the drone from entering the building, negating its ability to tag or disable enemies inside, and blocks player progression until the drone is manually recalled or the encounter is restarted.","affected_item":"Spider Drone (AI/physics)"}

{
  "reasoning": "I reviewed the character animation, environment assets, subtitle rendering, and physics interactions in this snowy outdoor scene. Footprints leave realistic impressions, models do not clip through each other or the ground, foliage and wreckage geometry remain stable, and subtitles are displayed correctly without artifacts. No pop-in, flicker, or other anomalies are present.",
  "bug_report_title": "No Visual Glitches Detected in Scene",
  "bug_report_description": "After close inspection of the five-frame sequence:
- Character models animate and move without clipping into terrain or each other.
- Snow footprint decals spawn and persist correctly behind the moving character.
- Background wreckage and foliage maintain consistent geometry and textures without pop-in or disappearing polygons.
- Subtitle text renders cleanly at the bottom of the screen.
- No frame-rate stutters, lighting flicker, or physics anomalies observed.

All elements behave as intended, so no corrective action is required.",
  "affected_item": "None"
}

{"reasoning":"In the clip, immediately after capturing Objective F the game fires off spawn-bonus notifications (“SQUAD SPAWN ON YOU,” “DRIVER SPAWN BONUS”) multiple times in rapid succession and then overlays a heavy, full-screen blur that persists even though the player remains alive in their vehicle. This event isn’t tied to death or a normal camera transition and blocks the view of the road ahead.","bug_report_title":"Duplicate spawn-bonus UI pop-ups and unintended full-screen blur on objective capture","bug_report_description":"When the team captures Objective F, the UI displays the same spawn-bonus text three times in a row, then immediately shifts into a blurred screen effect as if in a respawn/cutscene state. During this period the crosshair and much of the HUD disappear and the player loses clear visibility while driving. This UI misfire and blur overlay last several seconds, hindering player control and situational awareness.","affected_item":"UI/graphics"}

```json
{
  "reasoning": "Throughout the clip the third‐person camera repeatedly intersects the nearby shipping container/warehouse wall.  The camera does not push back or switch to first person, so the container’s geometry covers nearly half the screen and blocks the player’s view.",
  "bug_report_title": "Third‐person camera clips inside environment geometry",
  "bug_report_description": "When driving the box truck in third‐person, the camera collides directly with the adjacent shipping container/warehouse wall.  Instead of rolling back or adjusting its position, the camera clips into the solid mesh, rendering the entire left side of the viewport unusable.  This severely impairs visibility during close‐quarters maneuvers and can lead to gameplay mistakes or collisions.  Expected behavior would be for the camera to automatically back away from or switch to a clear view when an obstacle is too close.",
  "affected_item": "Camera / Environment collision"
}
```

{"reasoning":"While traversing the unfinished rooftop scaffolding, sections of the wooden floor and surrounding fencing repeatedly failed to load their geometry and collision, allowing the player to fall through. At the same time, distant building facades and fence meshes rendered as featureless black silhouettes until much later in the scene. Both issues indicate that environment assets are not streaming in properly, causing missing collision and untextured geometry.","bug_report_title":"Environment streaming failure causes missing collision and blacked-out meshes","bug_report_description":"On the rooftop scaffolding section, portions of the wooden planks and adjacent fencing intermittently do not render or register collision, allowing the player character to fall through the floor. Simultaneously, nearby buildings and fence segments appear as large untextured black silhouettes before finally popping in. These symptoms point to an environment asset streaming or LOD loading issue where meshes and textures fail to load in time, breaking immersion and potentially trapping the player or unintendedly dropping them into voids.","affected_item":"environment"}

{"reasoning":"In the later portion of the clip (after the kill-cam), you can see an enemy player clip up onto a thin street sign/wayfinding post above the stairwell and remain suspended in mid-air. The sign isn’t intended to be a walkable surface – the character model defies gravity and stands on non-traversable geometry, which clearly indicates a collision/physics glitch.","bug_report_title":"Character Clipping onto Street Sign and Floating in Mid-Air","bug_report_description":"While moving up the stairs, an enemy soldier’s character model clips into and stands on a decorative street sign (a small wayfinding/arrow post) above head height. The sign mesh is not defined as a walkable surface, yet the player is able to occupy that space, remain suspended without falling, and gain an unnatural vantage point. This breaks immersion, may grant unfair sightlines, and suggests incorrect collision bounds or physics handling on that environmental prop.","affected_item":"Environment collision/physics"}

{"reasoning":"During a collision between the Oppressor Mk II hoverbike and the large glass panels of the hangar, the bike’s rotor and body geometry repeatedly pass through the glass and wall mesh rather than bouncing off or properly fracturing the glass. The building’s collision boundaries aren’t correctly registered, causing the hoverbike to clip into the structure, ragdoll in place, and then continue on an unexpected trajectory.","bug_report_title":"Oppressor Mk II Rotors and Body Clip Through Hangar Glass on Impact","bug_report_description":"When flying the Oppressor Mk II into the glass façade of the hangar at LSIA, the bike’s rotor blades and chassis clip through the window mesh instead of triggering a glass shatter and proper bounce. The glass panel shows bullet‐hole decals but remains intact, while the bike penetrates the geometry and spawns inside the wall for several frames. The incorrect collision handling temporarily traps the vehicle in the wall before releasing it at an odd angle, resulting in unexpected physics behavior that kills the player. Steps to reproduce: 
1. Equip and call in the Oppressor Mk II near the large glass hangar doors at LSIA. 
2. Accelerate the hoverbike directly at the glass panel. 
3. Observe that the rotors and body pass through the glass rather than shattering it or bouncing off. 
4. Note how the vehicle becomes stuck inside the wall’s collision volume and then ejects unpredictably, often killing the player. This issue could confuse new players, break immersion, and potentially cause crashes if the vehicle becomes irrecoverably stuck in geometry.","affected_item":"Vehicle physics & collision (Oppressor Mk II) and environment geometry (hangar glass panels)"}

{"reasoning":"During a routine sliding tackle, the defending player’s collision physics triggered an extreme vertical launch. The tackled player catapults straight up with an unnatural rotation before landing, indicating a failure in the collision and ragdoll/animation system.","bug_report_title":"Player model launches vertically during sliding tackle","bug_report_description":"When Player A performs a sliding tackle on Player B, Player B’s collision response causes them to be launched straight up approximately three times higher than normal jump height. The character rotates awkwardly in mid-air and falls back to the ground in a rigid, non-physical manner. This glitch breaks immersion and could affect gameplay by causing unpredictable ball possession outcomes and unfair fouls.","affected_item":"Physics/Animation (Player collision response)"}

{"reasoning":"The sequence shows a hacked target NPC on the rooftop held in place by a visible tether line that clips through the building’s collision mesh. Instead of standing flush on the roof, the NPC is suspended slightly above it and continues walking in mid-air, with the hack rope anchoring to an invisible point inside the wall even after hacking ends.","bug_report_title":"Hacked NPC floats above roof with tether line clipping through geometry","bug_report_description":"When the player hacks the rooftop NPC, the visual tether incorrectly attaches to the building’s internal collision mesh rather than the camera device. The result is the NPC hovering just above the roof tiles and walking in mid-air, while the rope graphic penetrates the wall. This persists after hack completion, breaking NPC physics and immersion, and may interfere with subsequent collision or animation behaviors.","affected_item":"physics"}

{"reasoning":"During the ride sequence the on-screen mini-map (bottom right corner) is consistently overlaid by a solid black smear that never clears or updates. This artifact persists across multiple CTOS status changes and camera angles, obstructing the player’s view of their location. The rest of the scene renders correctly, which indicates this is a HUD rendering bug rather than an intended effect.","bug_report_title":"Persistent Black Smear Obscuring Mini-Map","bug_report_description":"While riding the elevated train, the mini-map UI element in the bottom right is covered by a continuous black blob. It does not fade out, move, or update even when the train switches between CTOS zones (\"Parker Square\" to \"The Loop\"). This obstructs navigation and makes waypoint tracking impossible during transit. The artifact remains regardless of camera rotation or CTOS status, suggesting a failure in HUD render buffer clearing or texture layering.","affected_item":"UI (mini-map HUD)"}

{"reasoning":"During normal traversal of the castle parapet, the character steps onto what looks like solid wooden planks/rubble, but that geometry lacks proper collision. Instead of stopping on the surface, the player falls clean through the level into an endless void, even through the pause menu transition. This is clearly a missing or disabled collision on the environment mesh.","bug_report_title":"Missing collision on parapet planks causes player to fall through level","bug_report_description":"While exploring the upper walkway (castle parapet) the player reaches a section of wooden planks/rubble adjacent to a red barrel and attempts to walk across. That geometry does not have solid collision enabled, so the character falls straight through the mesh and drops into the void below. The fall continues even when the pause menu is opened, indicating the physics still run on the invisible floor. This can soft-lock the player or require a reload, disrupting gameplay flow and potentially blocking progress.","affected_item":"Environment geometry/collision"}

{"reasoning":"During the scripted knock-out sequence the older civilian NPC is struck and pushed into a storefront window. Instead of playing a rag-doll or proper collision response, his character model clips through the window and then abruptly reappears kneeling behind the player several moments later. This looks like a physics/collision failure combined with an unintended teleport.","bug_report_title":"NPC collision clipping and teleport on knock-out","bug_report_description":"When the player delivers the baton strike to the older civilian, the NPC should enter a rag-doll state upon impact with the storefront glass. Instead, the NPC clips through the window geometry and becomes invisible, then instantly teleports to a kneeling position behind the player. This breaks immersion and can obscure visual feedback of enemy incapacitation. It may also leave orphaned props (umbrella, briefcase) on the ground with no corresponding character.","affected_item":"NPC physics/collision (rag-doll)"}

{"reasoning":"During the sequence an NPC’s carried briefcase (or tool) clips directly into and through the truck’s front wheel assembly rather than being stopped by the vehicle’s collision mesh. The item is drawn halfway inside the pickup’s fender and wheel, then locked there until the next animation, indicating a physics/collision detection error.","bug_report_title":"Briefcase Clipping Through Vehicle Collision Mesh","bug_report_description":"When the NPC interacts near the red pickup truck, the briefcase they carry penetrates the truck’s front wheel and fender without collision response. The object ends up half-embedded in the wheel arch and remains stuck until the animation moves it clear. This breaks immersion, can confuse AI pathing and object retrieval, and may block future physics interactions or pickups.","affected_item":"object physics/collision"}

{"reasoning":"In this sequence the ball’s physics and collision appear to fail. Rather than bouncing off the rim, backboard, another player, or going out of bounds, the basketball floats unnaturally through the court area and then collides with a sideline cameraman/referee model. The camera crew and ref are noninteractive, yet the ball gets “caught” and bounces off their heads mid-air. This indicates a collision mesh or physics assignment error where the ball is reacting to the wrong object and ignoring proper court boundaries and player collisions.","bug_report_title":"Basketball floats and collides with sideline crew due to physics/collision error","bug_report_description":"During live gameplay the basketball dribbling animation abruptly ignores player and court boundary collisions. The ball enters the sideline area and intersects the camera operator and referee models, bouncing off their heads before dropping. This glitch breaks immersion, can lead to unpredictable ball behavior, and may result in unfair turnovers or out-of-bounds calls. The issue appears to stem from incorrect collision layers or missing physics flags on the court edge and non-player models.","affected_item":"physics (collision)"}

```json
{
  "reasoning": "The player’s avatar is shown in a continuous prone/swimming animation while hovering above the ground with no collision. The game is still prompting “Exit Vehicle / Switch Seats,” yet there is no visible vehicle and the character is sliding over geometry without correctly interacting with the terrain or triggering any stand-up animation.",
  "bug_report_title": "Spectator/Photo Mode – Player Model Hovers & ‘Swims’ Over Terrain",
  "bug_report_description": "When entering photo or spectator mode while in a vehicle, the player model is ejected but remains in its prone swim animation. There’s no vehicle visible, and collision with the ground is disabled, causing the character to float and slide across the foliage and rocks. The animation and physics remain frozen in a ‘swimming’ loop, breaking immersion and potentially hiding other world geometry or clipping issues.",
  "affected_item": "Character physics & animation (player model collision)"
}
```

{"reasoning":"During the takedown on the snowy street two identical enemy ragdoll models collapse into exactly the same spot on the lamp-post and their webbing geometry stacks on itself. Both bodies remain stuck and overlap inside the web mesh instead of falling separately, producing a tangled, duplicated effect.","bug_report_title":"Overlapping ragdoll models stuck in web tether","bug_report_description":"When Spider-Man performs the dual web takedown on two enemies near the lamp-post, both ragdoll models collapse into the exact same position. Their meshes and the web physics stack on each other and become frozen in place, making it hard to distinguish the two bodies and creating an obvious visual overlap. The stuck bodies do not resolve or fall away naturally, which breaks immersion and could confuse players about enemy status.","affected_item":"Character physics (ragdoll/web tether)"}

{"reasoning":"An AI‐controlled teammate (indicated by the “Follow” prompt) attempts to move past a closed metal shutter and an abandoned car but becomes embedded in the car’s door and wall geometry. The character’s limbs clip through both the vehicle and the shutter, and the follow prompt never clears, indicating a navigation/physics collision failure.","bug_report_title":"Ally AI Clips Through Car and Metal Shutter","bug_report_description":"When ordering the AI teammate to follow, the character walks directly into a parked, damaged car and a lowered metal shutter. Instead of finding a clear path, the character’s collision bounds intersect both the car door and the shutter, causing parts of the model to appear inside solid objects. The AI becomes stuck in place, its limbs bent unnaturally, and the mission cannot progress because the “Follow” objective marker remains active.","affected_item":"character (AI teammate)"}

```json
{
  "reasoning": "When the two wrestlers collide and are thrown against the ropes, the red ring ropes stretch, bend through the posts and then pop out of their anchor points in ways that defy any realistic constraint. The rope segments behave as if their joints aren’t properly fixed, and the entire post assembly eventually collapses unnaturally.",
  "bug_report_title": "Ring ropes warp and detach from posts under collision physics",
  "bug_report_description": "During a grappling exchange, heavy impact on the ring ropes causes them to over-stretch and clip through the ring posts instead of remaining taut. The rope segments bend at impossible angles and ultimately detach from their anchor points, bringing down the top rail assembly. This break in constraint physics both looks jarring and allows characters to exit the ring in ways not intended, potentially letting players bypass collision boundaries or trigger further unstable physics interactions.",
  "affected_item": "environment (ring rope/post physics)"
}
```

{"reasoning":"During close-quarters combat the player knocks an enemy up onto the two-story wooden scaffold above the supplies stall. Instead of landing solidly on the floorboards the enemy briefly clips into the platform then vanishes from the higher level. Their ragdoll model falls straight through the geometry and reappears on the ground below in an unexpected spot.","bug_report_title":"Enemy ragdoll clips through wooden scaffold","bug_report_description":"While fighting near the market stall, throwing or launching an enemy onto the elevated wooden scaffold causes the character’s ragdoll physics to ignore the platform collision. The enemy model sinks into and through the scaffold rather than resting on it, disappearing from view on the second story and reappearing below. This unintended clipping breaks immersion, can block areas with hidden bodies, and may prevent expected interactions (pickup prompts, loot).","affected_item":"Physics"}

{"reasoning":"During normal exploration of a snowy street environment, an unnaturally dark, cavern-like hole in the road surface suddenly appears beneath the player character and accompanying AI dog. The depression has no surrounding geometry or texture detail, and it persists as the player moves, indicating a failure in terrain collision/shader rendering rather than an intentional game feature.","bug_report_title":"Unexpected Dark Pit in Road Terrain","bug_report_description":"While traversing a snow-covered street, a large, featureless black hole suddenly spawns in the ground. The ‘pit’ lacks any mesh or proper texturing and remains static underfoot, breaking immersion and potentially interfering with AI pathfinding or player movement. It does not react to physics or character interaction, and characters appear to partly clip into it. The hole disappears only upon reloading or leaving the area, suggesting a glitch in the terrain shader or mesh data.","affected_item":"environment (terrain/road mesh and shader)"}

{"reasoning":"As the player and another rider pass under the large overhead crane supports on the port road, the other rider’s motorcycle suddenly collides with an invisible or misaligned collider and is launched straight up into the air despite no ramp or player input. This is not intended behavior and indicates a physics/collision detection anomaly.","bug_report_title":"Motorcycle Unexpected Vertical Launch Through Overhead Structure","bug_report_description":"While free-roaming on the port road, approaching the tall crane support frames causes nearby motorcycles to hit a faulty collision volume. Instead of riding smoothly beneath the structure, the bike abruptly shoots vertically through the beams and hovers mid-air before falling back down. This disrupts gameplay flow, can break immersion, and may lead to crashes or stuck states when the vehicle geometry becomes interpenetrated.","affected_item":"Vehicle physics / collision detection"}

{"reasoning":"While browsing the satchel sell menu, each time Arthur’s cash total updates the HUD value sometimes drops its leading digit (e.g. showing “$65.68” instead of “$665.36”) before snapping back to the correct amount. This clearly isn’t a change in actual balance but a UI redraw issue that hides the hundreds digit intermittently as the number changes.","bug_report_title":"Satchel Menu Currency Display Loses Leading Digit on Update","bug_report_description":"When cycling through items to sell in the satchel, the on-screen cash total in the top right occasionally fails to redraw its first digit. For example, after selling an item it will briefly display “$65.68” when the real total is “$665.36.” The display then corrects itself a moment later. This glitch only affects the visual HUD element and does not actually alter the player’s funds, but it can confuse players and make it hard to confirm sale totals at a glance.","affected_item":"UI"}

{"reasoning":"Throughout the clip the football is rendered as a perfectly circular, flat disc rather than the game’s standard prolate spheroid shape, indicating a mesh or asset swap error.","bug_report_title":"Football rendered as flat circular disc","bug_report_description":"In multiple frames the ball appears as a simple circular disk instead of an elongated football. This suggests the wrong mesh or texture was loaded for the ball object. The visual discrepancy breaks immersion and may affect physics or collision detection tied to the ball’s shape.","affected_item":"object (football model)"}

{"reasoning":"During the clip, an enemy helicopter flies under a metal bridge and its collision box clips directly into the bridge’s underside. Instead of bouncing off or exploding, the chopper becomes lodged in the bridge geometry, producing sparks and remaining suspended in mid‐air. Its rotor animation continues but physics no longer apply, preventing any meaningful interaction or destruction.","bug_report_title":"Helicopter Clipping and Sticking Inside Bridge Geometry","bug_report_description":"An AI-controlled helicopter collides with the underside of a bridge at full speed yet fails to bounce off or explode. Instead, it clips into the bridge mesh, becoming stuck in mid-air. Sparks appear where the rotor and body intersect the bridge, but the vehicle remains intact and immobile. This collision glitch disrupts expected physics (no bounce or crash) and can break mission flow by leaving an indestructible obstacle suspended in the environment.","affected_item":"vehicle physics / environment collision"}

{"reasoning":"Throughout the clip, a crow NPC appears as a solid, featureless black silhouette, then clips into the ground and remains stuck without any flapping animation or proper physics response. The model’s textures failed to load and it failed to collide normally with the floor.","bug_report_title":"Crow NPC Missing Textures and Clipping into Floor","bug_report_description":"When the player uses the Gravity Gun on the crow, its model loses all texture data and renders as a flat black shape. Immediately after, it falls through the concrete floor, becomes stuck at ground level, and never resumes its flight animation or physics behavior. This breaks visual fidelity, may confuse players about whether the crow is interactable, and can block passage if the stuck entity overlaps player movement.","affected_item":"Character (crow NPC)"}

{"reasoning":"During the close-quarters takedown sequence, the horizontal metal cables that form the guardrail fence repeatedly pass right through the protagonist’s and enemy’s meshes (no collision) and even disappear or flicker in and out of view mid-animation. This both breaks immersion and could allow the player to inadvertently exploit clipping to bypass the barrier entirely.","bug_report_title":"Horizontal fence cables clip through character models and flicker","bug_report_description":"When the player initiates the stealth takedown against an NPC near the metal cable barrier, the horizontal cables exhibit two issues: 1) They have no collision during the animation, allowing both the player character and the NPC model to phase through the cables. 2) The cable geometry sometimes disappears or flickers, revealing the area beyond the barrier. These combined glitches look like the fence isn’t solid, undermining spatial boundaries and immersion.","affected_item":"Environment geometry (horizontal cable fence)"}

{"reasoning":"Throughout the clip the destination marker (the “1.7 MI DESTINATION” text and vertical line) appears to be rendered as a world‐space object and gets stuck behind trees or clipped through scenery rather than following the player’s HUD or mini-map. This looks like a UI positioning bug where the waypoint isn’t transformed into screen space properly.","bug_report_title":"World‐space destination marker clipping into environment","bug_report_description":"The in-game destination waypoint (“1.7 MI DESTINATION” vertical line and label) is being drawn in world space instead of on the HUD. As a result, the marker remains at a fixed position in the environment, clips through trees and terrain, and does not update relative to the player’s screen position. This obscures the player’s view, makes navigation confusing, and undermines the intended UI guidance.","affected_item":"UI (navigation waypoint marker)"}

{"reasoning":"In the captured sequence, an AI-controlled guard runs into view from the right but then abruptly vanishes—its mesh flickers and disappears—before ever reaching the doorway. This indicates an issue with the engine’s occlusion culling or LOD system mistakenly hiding the character.","bug_report_title":"AI Guard Abruptly Disappears Mid-Run Due to Incorrect Occlusion Culling","bug_report_description":"When the guard enters the player’s line of sight, its animation and mesh begin normally, but as it approaches the entrance, the model flickers out and is removed from the scene even though it has not passed behind any solid object. This premature culling breaks immersion, prevents proper engagement, and may cause pathfinding or collision errors if the AI is still logically present while visually absent. Likely tied to misconfigured culling volumes or overly aggressive LOD transitions.","affected_item":"Environment/AI Character Rendering (Occlusion Culling)"}

```json
{
    "reasoning": "When repeatedly shooting a flying bird with a bow, the arrows embed briefly but then detach and remain clustered in mid-air before vanishing. This non-normal behaviour indicates a problem with projectile collision/physics and rendering of stuck arrows.",
    "bug_report_title": "Arrows Detach and Float in Mid-Air After Hitting Flying Bird",
    "bug_report_description": "While targeting a bird in flight, each arrow impact temporarily sticks to the creature. Immediately afterwards the arrows pop free, clump together in mid-air around the bird’s last position, and remain suspended even after the bird flies away. Finally, all arrow meshes disappear abruptly. This glitch breaks immersion, may confuse line-of-sight checks, and could lead to orphaned arrow objects accumulating in the world before they despawn.",
    "affected_item": "Projectile physics/rendering (arrow meshes and collision)"
}
```

```json
{
  "reasoning": "During the “Beyond Hill and Dale” quest when Longlocks summons the unicorn, the creature repeatedly spawns clipped inside the giant toadstool/tree geometry and bush foliage. The physics engine then violently ejects it in short, jerky bursts rather than having it smoothly materialize or walk free, indicating a collision/physics glitch.",
  "bug_report_title": "Summoned Unicorn Clips into Environment and Jerks Free",
```
